page.title: 10INDUSTRY IN TEYNHAM
page.content: Lacron is a firm which makes filters and spa baths. The workshops are con- verted oasthouses on the A2 in Teyn- ham. The filters are used for agri- culture, fish farming and swimming pools. 80% of the production is ex- ported.The largest filters cost Â£1500. Most use silica sand but occasionally anthracite or coral sand is used. Each filter is pressure tested. About 100 filters are produced each day.They are made of fibreglass which is hand cut. Their main rivals are American firms. Lacron started in Teynham in 1970. It has 50 employees and is expanding. Spa baths are a recent development made in a new building. 80% are exported. The most expensive spa bath has gold plat- ed taps and sells for about Â£3000. The workforce usually work from 8am to 6pm but this varies according to demand.
